_header: Lullay lullay little child child rest thee a throw
Note: For a lullaby in the same measure but not sung by the Virgin Mary see 3302.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, lullay songs of; lullabies
_description: A Lullaby of the Virgin Mary — 32 lines (alternating aaaa with multiple couplets) in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

NLS18721.First Lines:
Lullay lullay litel child cild reste ȝe a þroweffro
                    heyȝe hider art þu sent with us to wone lowe…
NLS18721.Last Lines:
…Lullay lullay litel child softe slep & fasteIn sorwe
                    enden eueri loue but þin at þe laste Amen
NLS18721.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.

            1952: 83-4.
Stevick,  Robert D.,
                        ed.  
             One Hundred Middle English Lyrics.
         Indianapolis: Bobbs-Merrill, 1964: 66-7.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 195-6.
